what: Read and Manipulate Camera Trap Data Packages
title: Read and Manipulate Camera Trap Data Packages
text: Camtrapdp R package read manipulate Camera Trap Data Packages (Camtrap DP). Camtrap DP data exchange format camera trap data. camtrapdp can read, filter transform data (including Darwin Core) analysis e.g.¬†camtraptor camtrapR. get started, see: Function reference: overview functions.

title: Read and Manipulate Camera Trap Data Packages
text: Install latest released version CRAN: development version GitHub:

title: Read and Manipulate Camera Trap Data Packages
text: camtrapdp can read Camtrap DP dataset R environment: read_camtrapdp() automatically upgrade older version Camtrap DP latest version. also make data easier use, assigning taxonomic information (found metadata) observations eventIDs (found observations) media. access data, use one accessor functions like locations(): can also filter data one filter functions, automatically filter related data. example, filter observations scientific name(s) return associated events subset: functionality, see function reference.
code: library(camtrapdp)  file <- "https://raw.githubusercontent.com/tdwg/camtrap-dp/1.0/example/datapackage.json" x <- read_camtrapdp(file) x #> A Camera Trap Data Package "camtrap-dp-example-dataset" with 3 tables: #> ‚Ä¢ deployments: 4 rows #> ‚Ä¢ media: 423 rows #> ‚Ä¢ observations: 549 rows #>  #> And 1 additional resource: #> ‚Ä¢ individuals #> Use `unclass()` to print the Data Package as a list. locations(x) #> # A tibble: 4 √ó 5 #>   locationID locationName               latitude longitude coordinateUncertainty #>   <chr>      <chr>                         <dbl>     <dbl>                 <dbl> #> 1 e254a13c   B_HS_val 2_processiepark       51.5      4.77                   187 #> 2 2df5259b   B_DL_val 5_beek kleine vi‚Ä¶     51.2      5.66                   187 #> 3 ff1535c0   B_DL_val 3_dikke boom          51.2      5.66                   187 #> 4 ce943ced   B_DM_val 4_'t WAD              50.7      4.01                   187 x %>%   filter_observations(     scientificName %in% c("Martes foina", "Mustela putorius")   ) %>%   events() #> # A tibble: 4 √ó 4 #>   deploymentID eventID  eventStart          eventEnd            #>   <chr>        <chr>    <dttm>              <dttm>              #> 1 577b543a     976129e2 2020-06-19 22:31:51 2020-06-19 22:31:56 #> 2 577b543a     b4b39b00 2020-06-23 23:33:53 2020-06-23 23:33:58 #> 3 577b543a     5be4f4ed 2020-06-28 22:01:12 2020-06-28 22:01:18 #> 4 577b543a     a60816f2 2020-06-28 23:33:16 2020-06-28 23:33:22

title: Merge two Camera Trap Data Packages ‚Äî merge_camtrapdp
text: single Camera Trap Data Package object combination x y.

title: Merge two Camera Trap Data Packages ‚Äî merge_camtrapdp
text: x y must unique dataset name x$name y$name. name used prefix identifiers data occur datasets. example: x contains deploymentIDs c("", "b"). y contains deploymentIDs c("b", "c"). merged xy contain deploymentIDs c("", "x_b", "y_b", "c"). Data merged follows: Deployments combined, deploymentID kept unique. Media combined, mediaID, deploymentID eventID kept unique. Observations combined, observationID, deploymentID, mediaID eventID kept unique. Additional resources retained, resource name kept unique. Metadata properties merged follows: name: Removed. id: Removed. created: Set current timestamp. title: Removed. contributors: Combined, duplicates removed. description: Combined two paragraphs. version: Set 1.0. keywords: Combined, duplicates removed. image: Removed. homepage: Removed. sources: Combined, duplicates removed. licenses: Combined, duplicates removed. bibliographicCitation: Removed. project$id: Removed. project$title: Combined. project$acronym: Removed. project$description: Combined two paragraphs. project$path: Removed. project$samplingDesign: Sampling design x. project$captureMethod: Combined, duplicates removed. project$individuals: TRUE one datasets TRUE. project$observationLevel: Combined, duplicates removed. coordinatePrecision: Set least precise coordinatePrecision. spatial: Reset based new deployments. temporal: Reset based new deployments. taxonomic: Combined, duplicates removed. relatedIdentifiers: Combined, duplicates removed. references: Combined, duplicates removed. Custom properties x also retained.

title: Merge two Camera Trap Data Packages ‚Äî merge_camtrapdp
code: x <- example_dataset() %>%   filter_deployments(deploymentID %in% c("00a2c20d", "29b7d356")) y <- example_dataset() %>%   filter_deployments(deploymentID %in% c("577b543a", "62c200a9")) x$name <- "x" y$name <- "y" merge_camtrapdp(x, y) #> A Camera Trap Data Package with 3 tables: #> ‚Ä¢ deployments: 4 rows #> ‚Ä¢ media: 423 rows #> ‚Ä¢ observations: 549 rows #>  #> And 2 additional resources: #> ‚Ä¢ x_individuals #> ‚Ä¢ y_individuals #> Use `unclass()` to print the Data Package as a list.

title: Read a Camera Trap Data Package ‚Äî read_camtrapdp
text: Camtrap DP metadata taxonomic property can contain extra information scientificName found observations. information can include higher taxonomy (family, order, etc.) vernacular names multiple languages. function automatically include taxonomic information observations, extra columns starting taxon..

title: Read a Camera Trap Data Package ‚Äî read_camtrapdp
text: Observations can contain two classifications two levels: Media-based observations (observationLevel = "media") based single media file directly linked via mediaID. Event-based observations (observationLevel = "event") based event, defined combination eventID, eventStart eventEnd. event can consist one media files, directly linked . function automatically assign eventIDs media, using media.deploymentID = event.deploymentID eventStart <= media.timestamp <= eventEnd. Note can result media linked multiple events (thus duplicated), example events sub-events defined.

title: Read a Camera Trap Data Package ‚Äî read_camtrapdp
text: Camtrap DP metadata spatial temporal property contains spatial temporal coverage package respectively. function automatically update spatial temporal scopes metadata based data.

title: Read a Camera Trap Data Package ‚Äî read_camtrapdp

title: Round coordinates to generalize camera trap locations ‚Äî round_coordinates
text: Rounding coordinates recommended method generalize sensitive biodiversity information (see Section 4.2 Chapman 2020). Use function data. Determine category sensitivity (see Section 2.2 Chapman 2020) choose associated number digits : function : Set coordinatePrecision metadata (original values overwritten): Round coordinates deployments selected number digits. Update coordinateUncertainy (meters) deployments. uncertainty based number digits latitude, following Table 3 Chapman & Wieczorek 2020: coordinatePrecision already present, function subtract coordinateUncertainty associated setting new uncertainty (e.g. 0.001 0.01 = original value - 157 + 1570 m). original value NA, function assume coordinates obtained GPS set original value = 30.

title: Round coordinates to generalize camera trap locations ‚Äî round_coordinates
code: x <- example_dataset()  # Original precision x$coordinatePrecision #> [1] 0.001  # Original coordinates and uncertainty deployments(x)[c("latitude", "longitude", "coordinateUncertainty")] #> # A tibble: 4 √ó 3 #>   latitude longitude coordinateUncertainty #>      <dbl>     <dbl>                 <dbl> #> 1     51.5      4.77                   187 #> 2     51.2      5.66                   187 #> 3     51.2      5.66                   187 #> 4     50.7      4.01                   187  # Round coordinates to 1 digit x_rounded <- round_coordinates(x, 1)  # Updated coordinatePrecision x_rounded$coordinatePrecision #> [1] 0.1  # Updated coordinates and uncertainty (original 187 - 147 + 14697 = 14737) deployments(x_rounded)[c("latitude", "longitude", "coordinateUncertainty")] #> # A tibble: 4 √ó 3 #>   latitude longitude coordinateUncertainty #>      <dbl>     <dbl>                 <dbl> #> 1     51.5       4.8                 14737 #> 2     51.2       5.7                 14737 #> 3     51.2       5.7                 14737 #> 4     50.7       4                   14737

title: Shift date-times ‚Äî shift_time
text: Shifts date-times selected deployments (associated media observations) specified duration. function can used correct date-time issues incorrectly set time zones. Deployments: deploymentStart deploymentEnd updated timestampIssues set FALSE. Media: timestamp updated. Observations: eventStart eventEnd updated. Metadata (x$temporal) updated match new temporal scope.

title: Shift date-times ‚Äî shift_time
text: x Camera Trap Data Package object, returned read_camtrapdp(). deployment_id One deploymentIDs. duration Difference current new date-times. Provide lubridate::duration() difftime.

title: Shift date-times ‚Äî shift_time
text: x shifted date-times.

title: Shift date-times ‚Äî shift_time
code: # Set desired duration between current and new date-times (e.g. 4 hours earlier) library(lubridate, warn.conflicts = FALSE) duration(-4, units = "hours") #> [1] "-14400s (~-4 hours)"  # Or calculate one based on two date-times current <- ymd_hms("2024-04-01T04:00:00", tz = "UTC") new <- ymd_hms("2024-04-01T00:00:00", tz = "UTC") duration <- as.duration(interval(current, new))  # Shift date-times for 2 deployments x <- example_dataset() x_shifted <- shift_time(x, c("00a2c20d", "29b7d356"), duration) #> ‚úî Date-times in selected deployments, media and observations were shifted by #>   -14400s (~-4 hours). E.g. 2020-05-30 02:57:37 is now 2020-05-29 22:57:37.  # Inspect results deployments(x)[, c("deploymentID", "deploymentStart", "deploymentEnd")] #> # A tibble: 4 √ó 3 #>   deploymentID deploymentStart     deploymentEnd       #>   <chr>        <dttm>              <dttm>              #> 1 00a2c20d     2020-05-30 02:57:37 2020-07-01 09:41:41 #> 2 29b7d356     2020-07-29 05:29:41 2020-08-08 04:20:40 #> 3 577b543a     2020-06-19 21:00:00 2020-06-28 23:33:22 #> 4 62c200a9     2021-03-27 20:38:18 2021-04-18 21:25:00 deployments(x_shifted)[, c("deploymentID", "deploymentStart", "deploymentEnd")] #> # A tibble: 4 √ó 3 #>   deploymentID deploymentStart     deploymentEnd       #>   <chr>        <dttm>              <dttm>              #> 1 00a2c20d     2020-05-29 22:57:37 2020-07-01 05:41:41 #> 2 29b7d356     2020-07-29 01:29:41 2020-08-08 00:20:40 #> 3 577b543a     2020-06-19 21:00:00 2020-06-28 23:33:22 #> 4 62c200a9     2021-03-27 20:38:18 2021-04-18 21:25:00

title: Transform a Camera Trap Data Package to a Darwin Core Archive ‚Äî write_dwc
text: CSV meta.xml files written disk. invisibly, list data frames transformed data.

title: Transform a Camera Trap Data Package to a Darwin Core Archive ‚Äî write_dwc
text: function follows recommendations Reyserhove et al. (2023) doi:10.35035/doc-0qzp-2x37  transform data : Occurrence core. Audubon/Audiovisual Media Description extension. meta.xml file. Key features Darwin Core transformation: Occurrence core contains one row per observation (dwc:occurrenceID = observationID). observations observationType = "animal" observationLevel = "event" included, thus excluding observations () humans, vehicles, blanks, unknowns, unclassified media-based. Observations classified humans 100% certainty get dwc:identificationVerificationStatus = "verified using recorded media". Deployment information included Occurrence core, location, habitat, dwc:samplingProtocol, deployment duration dwc:samplingEffort dwc:parentEventID = deploymentID grouping identifier. Event information included Occurrence core, event duration dwc:eventDate dwc:eventID = eventID grouping identifier. Media files included Audubon/Audiovisual Media Description extension, foreign key observation. media file used one observation repeated. Metadata used set following record-level terms: dwc:datasetID: x$id. dwc:datasetName: x$title. dwc:collectionCode: first source x$sources. dcterms:license: license name (e.g. CC0-1.0) x$licenses scope data. license name scope media used dcterms:rights Audubon Media Description extension. dcterms:rightsHolder: first contributor x$contributors role rightsHolder. dwc:dataGeneralizations: set x$coordinatePrecision defined.

title: Transform a Camera Trap Data Package to a Darwin Core Archive ‚Äî write_dwc
code: x <- example_dataset() write_dwc(x, directory = "my_directory") #>  #> ‚îÄ‚îÄ Transforming data to Darwin Core ‚îÄ‚îÄ #>  #> ‚îÄ‚îÄ Writing files ‚îÄ‚îÄ #>  #> ‚Ä¢ my_directory/occurrence.csv #> ‚Ä¢ my_directory/multimedia.csv #> ‚Ä¢ my_directory/meta.xml  # Clean up (don't do this if you want to keep your files) unlink("my_directory", recursive = TRUE)

title: Transform a Camera Trap Data Package to EML ‚Äî write_eml
text: Metadata derived provided x. following properties set: title: Title provided x$title. type: Set Occurrence keywords. subtype: Set Observation keywords. update frequency: Set unknown. description: Description provided x$description. derived_paragraph = TRUE generated paragraph added, e.g.: Data standardized Darwin Core using camtrapdp R package include observations (associated media) animals. Excluded records document blank unclassified media, vehicles observations humans. license: License scope data provided x$licenses. creators: Contributors provided x$contributors, excluding roles rightsHolder publisher. contact: Contributors role contact. none exist, first creator. metadata provider: contact. keywords: Keywords provided x$keywords. geographic coverage: Bounding box provided x$spatial. taxonomic coverage: Taxa provided x$taxonomic. temporal coverage: Date range provided x$temporal. project data: Title, acronym identifier, description, sampling design provided x$project. alternative identifier: Identifier provided x$id. DOI, new DOI created publishing GBIF. external link: URL project provided x$project$path. following properties set: publishing organization associated parties sampling methods citations collection data: applicable.

By feeding on rushes and reeds, these animals cause serious damage to the environment in which they live and endangered species suffer from habitat loss. The disappearance of reeds and digging in dikes represents a safety risk for humans in the lowland areas. With the LIFE project MICA (), the partners from the participating countries want to develop a transnational plan for the management of coypu and muskrat populations in Europe and aim to reduce their population. The objective of an effective population control of coypu and muskrat is to protect lowlands from flooding, to prevent crop damage and loss of biodiversity. The objective of the project is to serve as a pilot and demonstration project in which ‚Äòbest practices‚Äô are tested and new techniques are developed for a more efficient control of muskrat and coypu populations. title: camtrapdp (development version)
text: New function write_camtrapdp() writes Camera Trap Data Package disk datapackage.json CSV files (#137). New function merge_camtrapdp() allows merge two datasets (#112). New function write_eml() transforms Camtrap DP metadata EML (#99). New function round_coordinates() allows fuzzy/generalize location information rounding deployment latitude longitude. also updates coordinateUncertainty deployments coordinatePrecision spatial scope metadata (#106). New function shift_time() allows shift/correct date-times data metadata specified deploymentIDs duration (#108). New function individuals() returns data frame unique individuals (#149). filter_deployments() deployments()<- now update spatial, temporal taxonomic scope metadata based returned data (#100, #132). filter_observations(), filter_media(), media()<- observations()<- now update taxonomic scope metadata based returned data (#89, #100, #130). read_camtrapdp() now updates spatial temporal scope metadata based data (#130). read_camtrapdp() now upgrades datasets Camtrap DP 1.0.1. internal function convert() renamed upgrade() (#113). Internal function build_taxa() renamed taxonomic() (#130). taxa() now removes duplicates (#130). write_dwc() now adds identificationVerificationStatus observations classified humans 100% certainty (#158).

title: camtrapdp 0.3.1
text: CRAN release: 2024-07-05 Fix CRAN note (#102).

title: camtrapdp 0.3.0
text: New function print() prints human-readable summary Camera Trap Data Package (#8). Fix fieldsEnclosedBy issue meta.xml, GBIF occurrence processing correctly handles commas fields (#95). Fix CRAN note (#94).

title: camtrapdp 0.2.1
text: CRAN release: 2024-06-05 First release CRAN. üéâ write_dwc() longer writes "." default, since allowed CRAN policies. user needs explicitly define directory (#79).

title: camtrapdp 0.2.0
text: New function read_camtrapdp() reads data files Camtrap DP memory (#9). make data easier use, assigning taxonomic information (found metadata) observations eventIDs (found observations) media (#37). New accessor functions deployments(), media() observations() return data frame deployments, media observations respectively (#29). functions also assignment equivalent (#50). New accessor functions locations(), events() taxa() return data frame unique locations, events taxa respectively (#22, #57, #17). New functions filter_deployments(), filter_observations() filter_media() allow filter data. work similarly dplyr‚Äôs filter() (#23). New function write_dwc() transforms Camera Trap Data Package Darwin Core Archive (#55). New function example_package() returns latest Camtrap DP example dataset caches result (#24, #67). New function version() allows get version camtrapdp object. New internal function check_camtrapdp() validates camtrapdp object (#34). New internal function convert() converts camtrapdp objects latest version. function currently used, supported version Camtrap DP 1.0 (#9). dplyr‚Äôs pipe (%>%) included NAMESPACE, don‚Äôt load dplyr (magrittr) use (#56). %>% .data imported package level, can used functions without namespace (#37).
